#summary Java Bit Level I/O.
#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation

= Introduction =

A simple wrapper for bit level I/O with In|!OutputStream.


= Details =
You can read/write variable length of bits from/to !InputStream and !OutputStream.

== Exampe ==
{{{
class Sample {
    public String name; // US-ASCII; null if hidden
    public int age; // 8-bit unsigned integer; maximum 255
    public boolean married;
    public Int balance; // 29-bit unsigned integer. null if hidden
}


ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
BitOutput bo= new BitOutput(baos);

bo.writeASCII(sample.name);             // (1 + 31 + N) bits
bo.writeUnsignedInt(8, sample.age);     // 8 bits
bo.writeBoolean(sample.married);        // 1 bits
bo.writeINTEGER(29, sample.balance);    // (1 + 29) bits

output.align(1); // align to octet


ByteArrayInputStream bais = new ByteArrayOutputStream(baos.toByteArray());
BitInput bi = new BitInput(bais);

String name = bi.readASCII();
String age = bi.readUnsignedInt(8);
String married = bi.readBoolean();
String balance = bi.readINTEGER(29);

bi.align(1); // align to octet
}}}

== Values ==
|| *type(get/set)* || *bit range* || *notes* ||
|| Boolean || 1 || 1 for true; 0 for false ||
|| BOOLEAN || 1 + Boolean || nullable Boolean ||
|| unsignedInt || 1 ~ 31 || ||
|| unsignedINTEGER || 1 + unsignedInt || nullable unsigned Integer ||
|| Int || 2 ~ 32 || signed int ||
|| INTEGER || 1 + Int || nullable signed Integer ||
|| unsignedLong || 1 ~ 63 || unsigned long ||
|| unsignedLONG || 1 + unsignedLong || nullable unsigled Long ||
|| Long || 2 ~ 64 || signed long ||
|| LONG || 1 + Long || nullable signed Long ||
|| Bytes || 31 + 8N || N: number of bytes ||
|| BYTES || 1 + Bytes || nullable byte array ||
|| ASCII || 1 + 31 + 7N || N: number of characters ||
|| STRING || 1 + Bytes || nullable String ||
|| UTF (@deprecated) || 16 + 8N || !DataInput#readUTF<br/>!DataOutput#writeUTF||
